snippet: The Wall Street firm’s settlement is another step toward the end of more than a decade of litigation that followed the terrorism attacks on Sept. 11.
abstract: Cantor Fitzgerald reveals it will settle its lawsuit against American Airlines for $135 million; Cantor accused American Airlines of negligence in allowing five terrorists to board the plane in Boston that crashed into the World Trade Center’s north tower, killing 658 of Cantor’s almost 1,000 employees, in New York on Sept 11, 2001.
lead_paragraph: The Wall Street firm’s settlement is another step toward the end of more than a decade of litigation that followed the terrorism attacks on Sept. 11.

headline.main: Cantor Fitzgerald Settles 9/11 Suit Against American Airlines for $135 Million
headline.print_headline: Cantor Fitzgerald Says Airline Will Pay $135 Million to End 9/11 Lawsuit
